intro: Gagnebina commersoniana, commonly known as the Commerson's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with characteristic milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often as a shrub or small tree. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
